title: Cleanup
description: A pastor exhorts his parishioners to take back their city from the gangsters and corrupt politicians who have taken it over.

title: Mightier Than the Sword
description: A Baptist minister prints copies of the Bible in order to smuggle them behind the Iron Curtain.

title: The Pavement Pastor
description: A pastor who was born and raised in the tenements develops a dim view of the draft laws, resulting in his imprisonment.

title: Mother O'Brien
description: A police detective is torn between his duty to his family and his duty to his job when he finds out that his brother, a drug addict, is committing crimes to support his habit.

title: The Bowery Bishop
description: The minister of a Bowery mission has his donations stolen. A transient working in the mission kitchen knows who did it, and threatens revenge, but the minister persuades him not to, and give himself up to serve an old charge he's still wanted on. In Sing Sing, both men meet, and when the first is stabbed, it looks like a revenge murder.

title: Dig or Die, Brother Hyde
description: An itinerant pastor traveling the prairie tries to restore a woman's faith, and save her child's life, by using a little amateur psychology.

title: The Judge
description: In a wide-open, lawless town, the local minister has another job--he's the judge.

title: The Rabbi Davis Story
description: A courageous rabbi goes up against the crooked political machine that's victimizing the poor in his county.

title: The Comeback
description: A baseball pitcher returns wounded from World War II, believing his career to be over. A clergyman tries to help him get back in the major leagues.

title: The Man Who Walked on Water
The Patton Prayer
description: The story of United States Army Chaplain Brig. Gen. James H. O'Neil and his role in shaping the strategy of the late Gen. George C. Patton during WWII.

title: Jhonakehunkga Called Jim
description: In 1883 a clergyman is assigned to take over a mission on the Winnebago Indian reservation. The Indians doubt his sincerity and resist his efforts, and he tries to win them over by befriending the one boy who doesn't scorn him.
